div1.note:
The Buffalo Bill Wild West and Congress of Rough Riders of the World. Col. W. F. Cody (Buffalo Bill), President.
Nate Salsbury, Vice-Pres't and Manager.
John M. Burke, . . . General Manager.
Albert E. Scheible, . . . Business Manager.
Jule Keen, . . . Treasurer.
div1.p:
Yours 5th to [simple drawing of hand]2 allright. No I dont see how Cody City can get a long without a gin mill & Bob3 would be a Dandy. only he would keep me full all the time. But as you dontdon't drink it would make no difference to you— Now George— DontDon't over look a thing wire me from Sheridan about joint stock Co— Let me know about contract for our land from State Land Board

and Interior Dept— We must make no mistakes. or we will be laughed out of the Country. I depend on you to guard our interests. I trust you. dontdon't fail me—

back.note: Note 1: The year is not inscribed by Cody but is 1895 as determined by the Routes List: Buffalo Bill's Wild West performed in Altoona, Pennsylvania, September 7, 1895.
Note 2: Cody makes a simple drawing of a hand to indicate that Beck's letter of September 5th is "in hand."
